p: Fermentation raised the TA of raw TSF from 0.293 to 0.788 mg/100 g and of WSF from 0.27 to 0.73 mg/100 g (Figure 1b). These values were higher than that of sorghum flour (0.22 mg/100 g) reported by AbdelRahman et al. ( 2010). Further increase in TA was observed in fermented samples treated with FBFPF starter, with the increase becoming significant ( p ≤ 0.05) with increasing levels of FBFPF. A similar observation was reported by Nnam and Obiakor ( 2003). The decrease in pH with a concomitant increase in acidity may be due to the activity of LAB.
